subject: RE: [junit] Fw: [Fwd: How to detect an existense of some text in web-page?]
msgSnippet: This person s question was already answered over on the HtmlUnit email list, which is the correct place for this question (not the JUnit list). Todd.
messageBody:
This person's question was already answered over on the HtmlUnit email
list, which is the correct place for this question (not the JUnit list).


Todd.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Diana Zhverelo
> Sent: Thursday, January 25, 2007 6:24 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Fw: [Fwd: How to detect an existense of some
> text in web-page?]
>
> Hi!
> I am still trying to write simple htmlunit test cases... and
> I have some questions here...
>
> How can I detect some text in web page. Here I have "Web
> Camera" text and I need somehow check if it is on page or it is not
>
> <div class="portlet-wrap-title">
>
>
> <span class="portlet-title"
> id="portlet-title-bar_92_INSTANCE_soeL">
> Web Camera
> </span>
>
>
> </div>
> How could I come to span or to reach that text or how could I
> go through all the html and find that "Web Camera" text.
>
> Another question would be... we have <style type="text/css">
> and some text that describes style of the page. How could we
> check what font-family we have there. Is it possible?
>
> Thanks a lot
> Diana
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
